title: University of California Santa Cruz PRA Databases

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: University of California Santa Cruz PRA Databases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1 — any databases and/or spreadsheets used to track requests under the California Public Records Act from September 1, 2023 to the date of this request.
2 — any and all policy documents, manuals, memos and/or reports regarding the processing of public records requests from September 1, 2023 to the date of this request.

In the regard to the database requested in paragraph 1, please provide the database in its original electronic format pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code § 6253.9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton

title: DOGE–CFPB Communications Regarding Agency Restructuring and Enforcement (Jan–Present)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOGE–CFPB Communications Regarding Agency Restructuring and Enforcement (Jan–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Freedom of Information Act, I request access to all communications (including emails, memos, or written directives) from January 1, 2025 to present between any representative of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and CFPB leadership (including the Acting Director and Chief Operating Officer). Please note that a federal judge has ruled DOGE is subject to FOIA (CREW v. DOGE, March 10, 2025), and has ordered expedited processing and full document preservation. This request falls squarely within the scope of that ruling.

Please include any documents that discuss:

Agency restructuring

Staff reductions, layoffs, or reassignments

Budget changes

Suspension or freezing of enforcement activities

I am a private citizen requesting this information for personal, non-commercial use.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andy Dufresne

title: Black (African) Book Publishers, Distributors, Stores, Authors and/or Titles

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Black (African) Book Publishers, Distributors, Stores, Authors and/or Titles
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In October 1968, J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI (All Field Offices) launched a COINTELPRO Operation against black independent bookstores (booksellers), associations, distributors, publishers, authors, titles, etc. It was modeled after similar operations since the 1920s against independent, radical, leftist, socialist, communist, and other bookstores (booksellers), associations, distributors, publishers, authors, titles, etc.

Each FBI Office and Sub-Office was required to (1) identify bookstores in their territory, and (2) open investigations on each to determine if it was extremist in nature,” (3) the identities of the owners; (4) whether it is a front for any group or foreign interest; (5) whether individuals affiliated with the store engage in extremist activities; (5) the number, type, and source of books and material on sale; (5) the store’s financial condition; (6) its clientele; and (7) whether it is used as a headquarters or meeting place.”

We are especially interested about books by and about Kwame Nkrumah and Panaf Books (Press), Sekou Toure, Malcolm X, Marcus Garvey, Mao Tse Tung

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ROBERT BROWN

title: Charles Newsome Murder Evidence

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Charles Newsome Murder Evidence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All evidence in relations to the case of Kendrick D. Gillum, Antonio Williams, and Demarco Wilson’s murder of Charles Newsome (hereinafter "the case of Charles Newsome's murder").
2. All records cataloging the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome's murder, and identifying the location(s) of the evidence at the time of such cataloging.
3. All records, if any, referencing the “loss” of any of the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder.
4. All records, if any, referencing the “misplacement” of any of the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder.
5. All records, if any, referencing to the signing out of any of the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder, and any returning of evidence that had been signed out.
6. All records identifying any policies or procedures to be followed by the WMPD in preserving evidence seized in criminal cases.
7. All records evidencing any communications by one or more of the West Memphis Police Department police officers or any other members of the WMPD and any third-parties concerning the evidence in the case of Charles Newsome’s murder from February 1, 1997 to date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Marc Howard.

communications.subject: RE: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Charles Newsome Murder Evidence
communications.communication: This was a West Memphis case and we are not in possession of the records that you are requesting.

title: Police Rosters + Photos (Long Beach Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

The roster of sworn police officers from 2016 - 2024
Names, badge numbers, serial numbers, division/station, sworn status.

 The department's headshot photos of all of the same officers are referenced above. Duplicates from each year do not need to be completed. At a minimum, photos for 2023 - 2024 should be included. 

Precedent: Santa Ana Police Department and LAPD have released their photos. A reminder that nothing in California Penal Code 832.7 mentions photographs in personnel records are kept confidential. Not only that, but videos and pictures of officers are regularly shared on social media. 
https://www.courthousenews.com/judge-tosses-las-second-lawsuit-against-journalist-over-police-headshots/
https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2024-11-13/city-of-la-officers-city

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: FOIA Request - Fayette County Opioid Settlement Funds

communications.communication:
Ruth Lanier, County Administrator 
Fayette County Commission
100 N Court Street 
Fayetteville, WV 25840

Dear Ruth Lanier, 

Pursuant to the state open records law W.Va. Code Secs. 29B-1-1 to 29B-1-7, I write to request access to public records regarding Fayette County’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting copies of: 
the amount of funds Fayette County has received so far
the application to apply for funding
the individuals who will review the funding applications
the process by which funds will be awarded
documents or other information detailing how the opioid settlement funds distributed to Fayette County have been awarded through March 1, 2025, if at all, including budgets, grant allocations, and expenditure reports.
any existing or proposed plans outlining future use of said opioid settlement funds, including strategic plans, meeting minutes in which county-level officials participated, and correspondence and attachments regarding funding allocations.
any public reports, audits, or documentation created by the county regarding the accountability and impact of these funds
All attachments, addendums, appendices, exhibits, and other related documents that were included as part of the contracts.

If your agency does not maintain these public records, please let me know who does and include the proper custodian's name and address.
As provided by the open records law, I will expect your response within five (5) working days. See W. Va. Code Sec. 29B-1-3(d).
If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.
I would note that willful violation of the open records law is a misdemeanor, punishable by a fine of not less than $200 nor more than $1,000, or imprisonment in the county jail for twenty (20) days, or both. See W. Va. Code Sec. 29B-1-6. Court costs and attorney fees may also be awarded. See Sec. 29B-1-7.
Thank you for your assistance.
Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,
Aidan Cornue
(312) 458-5125
amc00069@mix.wvu.edu

title: FRS Reports (George Mason University)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024. Specifically:

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

title: CPRA Request – Arrest of Adriana Sandoval – January 23, 2024 (Barricade on I-215 with Children)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request – Arrest of Adriana Sandoval – January 23, 2024 (Barricade on I-215 with Children)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to all public records related to the January 23, 2024 arrest of Adriana Sandoval, who barricaded herself in her vehicle with her two children after a pursuit involving Riverside County Sheriff’s deputies.

Specifically, I request the following:

All body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the pursuit, standoff, and arrest of Adriana Sandoval.

All dash camera footage from any marked units involved in the chase or at the barricade scene.

All helicopter (aerial) or fixed-position freeway camera footage, if available, from I-215 near Blaine Street.

All rear-seat/in-cruiser footage of Ms. Sandoval or her children during transport.

Incident Summary (For Context):

Suspect: Adriana Sandoval (Age 35)

Date/Time: January 23, 2024 – Approx. 12:00 PM

Location: Origin – 23000 block Sunnymead Blvd, Moreno Valley → Westbound 60 Freeway → Northbound I-215

Key Events:

Deputies responded to a disturbance; Sandoval fled with her two children in the car

Pursuit reached highway speeds, multiple civilian vehicles struck

Barricaded in the middle of I-215 near Blaine St.

Jonathan Roldan (boyfriend) drove wrong way on opposing lanes during standoff

Both arrested; no injuries reported

Children placed in protective custody

Charges:

Sandoval: Felony evading, resisting arrest, hit-and-run (×3), child cruelty (×2), unlicensed driving

Roldan: Reckless driving, obstruction (misdemeanors)

This request is made in the public interest as the incident raises serious questions about crisis intervention, child endangerment response, and multi-agency freeway pursuit protocols. I am not requesting this information for commercial use and respectfully request a waiver of any fees. Please provide records in digital format, where possible.

If any records are withheld, please cite the specific exemption(s) and provide all segregable, redacted portions.

Please confirm receipt and provide an estimated timeline for response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request – Arrests of Hurguens Jasmin – January & March 2025 (Elmont, NY)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request public records concerning two arrests involving Hurguens Jasmin, a 29-year-old male from Elmont, NY, which occurred in January 2025 and March 21, 2025, both in Elmont and both involving physical altercations with Nassau County Police officers.

Specifically, I request the following records for both incidents:
All body-worn camera footage from all involved officers.

All dash camera footage from patrol vehicles on scene.

All rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage during detainment or transport.

The complete incident and arrest reports, including officer narratives, injury reports, use-of-force documentation, booking information, and property/evidence inventories.

Incident Summary for Reference:
March 21, 2025 Arrest
Time: ~3:50 PM

Location: South King Street, Elmont, NY

Charges:

3× Assault 2nd Degree (officer injuries)

Criminal Mischief 2nd Degree (property destruction)

Criminal Trespass 3rd Degree

Criminal Possession of a Weapon 3rd Degree (billy club)

Summary: Jasmin fled from officers attempting to arrest him on open warrants. He ran through private property, damaged fencing, resisted arrest, injured three officers, and was found to have a billy club in his waistband. All parties were treated at a local hospital.

This request is made in the public interest, not for commercial use. The incidents involve multiple officers being assaulted and repeated allegations of violent resistance, raising significant public concern over use-of-force, officer safety, and suspect handling in high-risk warrant apprehensions.

I respectfully request a waiver of all applicable fees and ask that responsive records be provided digitally. If any material is withheld, please provide specific statutory exemptions under FOIL and release all redacted, non-exempt content.

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide a timeline for response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – April 30, 2024 Vehicle Pursuit and Arrest of Daniel Maxwell

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – April 30, 2024 Vehicle Pursuit and Arrest of Daniel Maxwell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to public records related to the April 30, 2024 vehicle pursuit and arrest of Daniel Maxwell, which began in Levy County following a BOLO issued by the Chiefland Police Department and ended in Citrus County.

Specifically, I request the following:

All body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the pursuit and arrest, particularly Deputy Nick Duncan and Deputy Kelly Kimpel.

All dash camera footage from LCSO vehicles engaged in the pursuit.

All rear-seat (in-cruiser) camera footage during Maxwell’s transport, if applicable.

A copy of any aerial footage, surveillance, or publicly released video, including the 90-second pursuit clip referenced in your May 1, 2024 press release.

Incident Summary (for reference):

Name: Daniel Maxwell

DOB: 11/23/1983

Date of Arrest: April 30, 2024

Time: Approx. 9:30 AM

Location: US 19 (north of Inglis) → Crystal River (via Citrus County)

Agencies Involved: Levy County Sheriff’s Office, Chiefland PD (BOLO), Citrus County Sheriff’s Office

Charges:

Aggravated Fleeing/Eluding Law Enforcement

Grand Theft Auto

Driving While License Suspended

According to the public press release, the pursuit spanned approximately 20 miles, involved speeds over 100 mph, use of stop sticks, and ended when Maxwell crashed into a tree after hitting a power pole and mailboxes. Deputy Duncan used his vehicle to block a door and prevent foot pursuit.

This request is made in the public interest, not for commercial use. The incident involves law enforcement tactics during a multi-county pursuit and questions of public safety and use of force. I respectfully request a waiver of all applicable fees and digital delivery of all responsive records.

If any part of this request is denied, please provide the legal basis under Chapter 119, F.S., and release any redacted, non-exempt portions.

Please confirm receipt and provide an estimated timeline for response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Arrest of Alexis Mackenzie Franke – August 2, 2024 (I-95 DUI / Taser Incident)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request all available public records related to the arrest of Alexis Mackenzie Franke on or around August 2, 2024, by Florida Highway Patrol troopers following a DUI rollover crash in North Miami, near NW 135th Street on northbound I-95.

Specifically, I request:

All body-worn camera footage from FHP troopers involved in the incident and arrest.

All dash camera footage from FHP cruisers that responded to or documented the scene.

All in-vehicle (rear-seat) camera footage, including while Ms. Franke was detained or transported.


Incident Overview (from public media):

Name: Alexis Mackenzie Franke

Age: 24

Residence: Phoenix, Arizona

Date/Time: August 2, 2024, approx. 1:20 AM

Location: Northbound I-95 near NW 135th Street, North Miami, FL

Charges:

Aggravated Assault on Law Enforcement Officer (felony)

Resisting Arrest with Violence (felony)

Resisting Arrest without Violence (misdemeanor)

DUI (x2) – refusal of field sobriety and breath test

The subject was reportedly taken into custody after attempting to deploy a trooper’s Taser, following a single-vehicle DUI crash. She was booked into the Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center on a $10,000 bond.

This request is made in the public interest to promote transparency regarding law enforcement practices during high-risk roadside arrests involving potential weapon disarmament, DUI, and use-of-force protocols.

Sincerely,

communications.communication:
